definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To go out or go away from a place or situation ; to depart , to leave .

subdefinitions.definition: ( theater ) To leave a scene or depart from a stage .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , often euphemistic ) To depart from life ; to die .
( ambitransitive , computing ) To end or terminate (a program , subroutine , etc.)
( transitive , originally US , also figuratively ) To depart from or leave (a place or situation).

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive , specifically ) To alight or disembark from a vehicle .

definitions.definition: ( bridge , intransitive ) To give up the lead .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To go out or go away from a place or situation ; to depart , to leave .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , often euphemistic ) To depart from life ; to die .
( ambitransitive , computing ) To end or terminate (a program , subroutine , etc.)
( transitive , originally US , also figuratively ) To depart from or leave (a place or situation).
( bridge , intransitive ) To give up the lead .

definitions.definition: Used as a stage direction for an actor : to leave the scene or stage .

main_definition: ( intransitive , drama , also figuratively ) Used as a stage direction for an actor : to leave the scene or stage .
